EngText: <nickname>,
I’ll tell you a secret.

KorText: 난 너의 생각을 읽을 수 있어.
EngText: I can read your thoughts.
You cannot.
I can so. I’ll prove it.
Imagine.
You’re walking in the woods.

KorText: 그러던 중, 갑자기\n길이 두 갈래로 나뉘어.
EngText: Suddenly, the path you’re\non diverges into two.

KorText: 한 쪽은 햇살이 가득한\n벽돌 깔린 길이야.
EngText: One is a brick-lined road,\nbright with sunshine.
Fragrant flowers neatly grow on the side
and the red, orange, and yellow\nof the blooms catch your eye.

KorText: 다른 쪽은 다양한 크기의 나무들이\n아무데서나 자라고 있어.
EngText: The other has trees of all sizes\nstretching out from everywhere.
The thick greenery sways\nwildly with the wind
and a calm darkness\nhas descended onto it.
Which path would you choose?
The road with flowers.|The tree-filled road.
It seems beautiful and safe.
Hm, Interesting!
Okay.

KorText: 그렇게 선택한 길을 따라 걷고 있던 너는,
EngText: Then, as you are walking\nyour chosen path,

KorText: 길가에 물주머니와 강아지\n한 마리가 있는 걸 봤어.
EngText: you see a pouch of water and\na dog on the side of the road.

KorText: 그 옆에 있는 종이엔 이렇게 적혀있지.
EngText: A note beside it says:

KorText: “당신에겐 두 손이 있겠지요. 하지만\n다음 행인을 위해 하나만 가져가세요.”
EngText: “You may wish to take two\n but can only take one.”

KorText: 오직 하나만 선택할 수 있나 봐.\n어떤 걸 가져갈래?
EngText: It seems you can choose only one.\nWhich would you take with you?
The pouch of water, of course. | The dog.
I may have a long way to go.
Fascinating!
Now, let’s take a look at the results.

KorText: 첫 번째 질문은 너의 가장\n깊은 두려움을 드러내.
EngText: The first choice reveals\nyour deepest fear.
You chose the road with flowers.

KorText: 그곳은 밝고 안전해.새가 지저귀고\n나비가 네 어깨에 내려앉지.
EngText: It’s bright and safe. Birds are chirping\nand butterflies rest on your shoulder.
But how about the\npath lined with trees?
At first the cool shade\nmay have pleased you.

KorText: 하지만 어느새 거대해진\n그림자들이 너를 삼킬지 몰라!
EngText: But the looming shadows might\nswallow you before you know it!

KorText: 너는 분명 어둠에 대한 두려움이 있을 거야.
EngText: You have a fear of the\ndarkness, don’t you?

KorText: 어둡고 비밀스러운 것, 어디에서 무엇이\n튀어나올지 모르는 미지의 공포를 마주하는 것!
EngText: A fear of the unknown, of what might\nleap out at you from who knows where!

KorText: 어릴 때 꾸었던 최초의 악몽을 기억해 봐!
EngText: Think back to your very first\nnightmare when you were little.
You were on a mountain\nroad past midnight,

KorText: 서슬 퍼런 짐승의 어금니에 붙잡혀\n뜯겨 나가던 꿈이었을 거야!
EngText: and a vicious beast tore you\nto shreds with its teeth!
Then, the second choice.

KorText: 불확실한 미래를 앞두고 어떻게\n행동하는지에 대한 질문이었어.
EngText: It was about who you are when\nfaced with an unsure future.
If you chose the pouch of water,

KorText: 함께 하는 사람보단 어디로 가고\n있는지를 중요시한다는 뜻이야.
EngText: it means you value where you\nare going over who you are with.
Interesting… you must\nalways be thinking ahead.
I knew it, <nickname>!

KorText: 넌 내가 가진 어떤 질문에도,\n고민에도 답을 내놓았지.
EngText: You were always prepared for\nany question, any problem I had.
I knew I could always count on you.

KorText: 하지만 이런 상황이면 어떨까?\n완전, 그저, 오로지 가정일 뿐이야!
EngText: But let’s just say—assume,\nreally, completely theoretically.

KorText: 길가에 물주머니랑 내가\n나란히 있는 걸 봤다면.
EngText: You saw a pouch of water and\nme on the side of the road.
Hehe.
Which would you choose?
The pouch of water.|You.
Well.

KorText: 안녕. 나는 저 구석에서 울고 있을게.
EngText: Goodbye. For now.\nI’ll be crying over there.
Just in case you care.
I’m glad.
It’s nice to know that I mean more\nto you than a pouch of water!

KorText: 좋은 친구가 될 수 있을 거야.
EngText: I’ll make a great friend out of her.
Fascinating!
Now, let’s take a look at the results.

KorText: 첫 번째 질문은 너의 가장\n깊은 두려움을 드러내.
EngText: The first choice reveals\nyour deepest fear.
You chose the road with flowers.

KorText: 그곳은 밝고 안전해.새가 지저귀고\n나비가 네 어깨에 내려앉지.
EngText: It’s bright and safe. Birds are chirping\nand butterflies rest on your shoulder.
But how about the\npath lined with trees?
At first the cool shade\nmay have pleased you.

KorText: 하지만 어느새 거대해진\n그림자들이 너를 삼킬지 몰라!
EngText: But the looming shadows might\nswallow you before you know it!

KorText: 너는 분명 어둠에 대한 두려움이 있을 거야.
EngText: You have a fear of the\ndarkness, don’t you?

KorText: 어둡고 비밀스러운 것, 어디에서 무엇이\n튀어나올지 모르는 미지의 공포를 마주하는 것!
EngText: A fear of the unknown, of what might\nleap out at you from who knows where!

KorText: 어릴 때 꾸었던 최초의 악몽을 기억해 봐!
EngText: Think back to your very first\nnightmare when you were little.
You were on a mountain\nroad past midnight,

KorText: 서슬 퍼런 짐승의 어금니에 붙잡혀\n뜯겨 나가던 꿈이었을 거야!
EngText: and a vicious beast tore you\nto shreds with its teeth!
Then, the second choice.

KorText: 불확실한 미래를 앞두고 어떻게\n행동하는지에 대한 질문이었어.
EngText: It was about who you are when\nfaced with an unsure future.
If you chose the dog,

KorText: 어디로 가고 있는지보단 함께\n하는 사람을 중요시한다는 뜻이야.
EngText: it means you value who you are\nwith over where you are going.
Who you are with…
Do I count?
Of course.|Well….
I’m glad.
It’s nice to know that I mean more\nto you than a pouch of water!

KorText: 안녕. 나는 저 구석에서 울고 있을게.
EngText: Goodbye. For now.\nI’ll be crying over there.
Just in case you care.
It seems full of potential\nfor a distinct adventure.
Hm, Interesting!
Okay.

KorText: 그렇게 선택한 길을 따라 걷고 있던 너는,
EngText: Then, as you are walking\nyour chosen path,

KorText: 길가에 물주머니와 강아지\n한 마리가 있는 걸 봤어.
EngText: you see a pouch of water and\na dog on the side of the road.

KorText: 그 옆에 있는 종이엔 이렇게 적혀있지.
EngText: A note beside it says:

KorText: “당신에겐 두 손이 있겠지요. 하지만\n다음 행인을 위해 하나만 가져가세요.”
EngText: “You may wish to take two,\nbut can only take one.”

KorText: 오직 하나만 선택할 수 있나 봐.\n어떤 걸 가져갈래?
EngText: It seems you can choose only one.\nWhich would you take with you?
The pouch of water, of course. | The dog.
I may have a long way to go.
Fascinating!
Now, let’s take a look at the results.

KorText: 첫 번째 질문은 너의 가장\n깊은 두려움을 드러내.
EngText: The first choice reveals\nyour deepest fear.
You chose the tree-filled path.

KorText: 그곳은 조용하고 시원해. 나무들이 자애로운\n그림자를 드리우고, 싱그러운 샘물이 흐르지.
EngText: It’s quiet and cool. Trees with kind\nshadows, and a fresh stream of water.
But what about the path\nlined with flowers?
You’ll have to walk under\nthe scorching sun.

KorText: 처음엔 따뜻하다 느껴지겠지만, 나중엔\n타들어가는 햇볕이 널 갈증 나게 만들 거야!
EngText: At first it will be warm, but as time goes\nby, the thirst will be overwhelming!

KorText: 너는 분명 열기에 대한\n두려움이 있을 거야.
EngText: You have a fear of the heat, don’t you?

KorText: 어릴 때 꾸었던 최초의 악몽을 기억해 봐!
EngText: Think back to your very first\nnightmare when you were little.
The sun beat down on you,

KorText: 바짝 마른 시체처럼 물을 찾아\n떠돌고 있었을 거야!
EngText: and you were dead on your\nfeet, desperate for water!
Then, the second choice.

KorText: 불확실한 미래를 앞두고 어떻게\n행동하는지에 대한 질문이었어.
EngText: It was about who you are when\nfaced with an unsure future.
If you chose the pouch of water,

KorText: 함께 하는 사람보단 어디로 가고\n있는지를 중요시한다는 뜻이야.
EngText: it means you value where you\nare going over who you are with.
Interesting… you must\nalways be thinking ahead.
I knew it, <nickname>!

KorText: 넌 내가 가진 어떤 질문에도,\n고민에도 답을 내놓았지.
EngText: You were always prepared for\nany question, any problem I had.
I knew I could always count on you.

KorText: 하지만 이런 상황이면 어떨까?\n완전, 그저, 오로지 가정일 뿐이야!
EngText: But let’s just say—assume,\nreally, completely theoretically.

KorText: 길가에 물주머니랑 내가\n나란히 있는 걸 봤다면.
EngText: You saw a pouch of water and\nme on the side of the road.
Hehe.
Which would you choose?
The pouch of water.|You.
Well.

KorText: 안녕. 나는 저 구석에서 울고 있을게.
EngText: Goodbye. For now.\nI’ll be crying over there.
Just in case you care.
I’m glad.
It’s nice to know that I mean more\nto you than a pouch of water!

KorText: 좋은 친구가 될 수 있을 거야.
EngText: I’ll make a great friend out of her.
Fascinating!
Now, let’s take a look at the results.

KorText: 첫 번째 질문은 너의 가장\n깊은 두려움을 드러내.
EngText: The first choice reveals\nyour deepest fear.
You chose the tree-filled path.

KorText: 그곳은 조용하고 시원해. 나무들이 자애로운\n그림자를 드리우고, 싱그러운 샘물이 흐르지.
EngText: It’s quiet and cool. Trees with kind\nshadows, and a fresh stream of water.
But what about the path\nlined with flowers?
You’ll have to walk under\nthe scorching sun.

KorText: 처음엔 따뜻하다 느껴지겠지만, 나중엔\n타들어가는 햇볕이 널 갈증 나게 만들 거야!
EngText: At first it will be warm, but as time goes\nby, the thirst will be overwhelming!

KorText: 너는 분명 열기에 대한\n두려움이 있을 거야.
EngText: You have a fear of the heat, don’t you?

KorText: 어릴 때 꾸었던 최초의 악몽을 기억해 봐!
EngText: Think back to your very first\nnightmare when you were little.
The sun beat down on you,

KorText: 바짝 마른 시체처럼 물을 찾아\n떠돌고 있었을 거야!
EngText: and you were dead on your\nfeet, desperate for water!
Then, the second choice.

KorText: 불확실한 미래를 앞두고 어떻게\n행동하는지에 대한 질문이었어.
EngText: It was about who you are when\nfaced with an unsure future.
If you chose the dog,

KorText: 어디로 가고 있는지보단 함께\n하는 사람을 중요시한다는 뜻이야.
EngText: it means you value who you are\nwith over where you are going.
Who you are with…
Do I count?
Of course.|Well….
I’m glad.
It’s nice to know that I mean more\nto you than a pouch of water!

KorText: 안녕. 나는 저 구석에서 울고 있을게.
EngText: Goodbye. For now.\nI’ll be crying over there.
Just in case you care.
Alright… now this one goes here…
Look, I want to show you something.
What is it?
Ta-da.
It’s my collection.
I heard some humans ‘collect’ things.

KorText: 특별한 쓸모가 없더라도 본인의 기쁨을\n위해 물건을 모으고 바라보고 만진다며.
EngText: Not for practical reasons, but simply\nbecause it makes them happy.
I’ve started collecting to get\na taste of that happiness.

KorText: 내 수집 품목은 작고 동그란\n물건이야. 나랑 닮은!
EngText: Right now I’m collecting small\nand round objects. Just like me!
So far I’ve found three.
What do you think?

KorText: 수집은 고상한 취미지… 멋진 걸.|우와! 대단한 걸? 더 설명해 줘!
EngText: Collecting is a refined hobby… very nice.|Whoa! That’s amazing. Tell me more.
Look. Here’s a blueberry,\na coin, and a marble.

KorText: 동전은 다른 아이들에 비해 조금 납\n작하지만 끼고 싶어해서 넣어줬어.
EngText: The coin’s flatter than the others\nbut it didn’t want to feel left out.

KorText: 그리고 꼭 추가하고\n싶은 게 하나 있는데,
EngText: And something I’d really like\nto add to my collection,
is your eyeball.
Dissuade Dot|Freak out

KorText: (오, 세상에!) 하지만 뭉치, 눈알이\n없으면 난 세상을 볼 수 없는걸.
EngText: (Yikes!) But Dot, without my eyes I\nwouldn’t be able to see the world.

KorText: 어어?? 뭉치야, 왜 그런\n걸 원하는 거야?
EngText: What?? Dot, why on earth would\nyou want something ike that?
I guess that’s a no? I’m sorry.
I just…

KorText: 너라면 드넓은 세상을 두 눈알로\n마구 봤을 거라 생각했어.
EngText: I thought you would have seen the\nwide world with your two eyes.

KorText: 인간들이 살아가는 모습을 담아 놓은 물건\n중 하나만이라도 내가 수집할 수 있다면
EngText: If I could collect something that\nhad taken in how humans live,

KorText: 마치 세상을 보는 수정\n구슬을 가진 느낌일 거야!
EngText: it would be like having a crystal\nball to see the world with!

KorText: 그리고 그 세상이 ‘너의 시선’으로 담겨져서\n더 특별하게 느껴졌거든. 너의 눈알에!
EngText: And if it were your gaze, that would make\nit even more special. Hence your eyeball!
I guess my eyeball will\nhave to do, someday.

KorText: (무시무시한 생각이다….) 다시 한 번 생각해 보는 건 어떨까?
EngText: (Well, isn’t that terrifying….)\nWhy don’t you think it over?
(Please…!)
<nickname>, what does\nit mean to be complete?

KorText: 모든 게 갖추어진 것.|부족함이 없는 것.
EngText: To be whole.|To be flawless.

KorText: 모든 게 갖추어지고 부족함이 없다는 건
EngText: And does being whole and flawless mean
that one fills, swallows, paints, and grows,

KorText: 더 이상 어떤 결함도 없는\n상태를 말하는 거야?
EngText: until there are no more imperfections?
Do you want to be complete?

KorText: 될 수 있다면 거부하지 않겠어.|굳이. 지금 나의 모습으로 만족해.
EngText: I wouldn’t say no to it.|Not really. I’m fine with who I am.
Interesting…

KorText: 어떤 네 삶의 잔구름들이 너의\n그 대답을 만들어 냈는지
EngText: Share with me what faint clouds in your life

KorText: 시간을 들여 나에게 알려줘.\n네가 더 궁금해졌어.
EngText: led you to that answer.\nI want to know more about you.
Of course! If you’re interested.

KorText: 그런데 <nickname>. 완전해지는\n건 곧 성장이라고 부를 수 있을까?
EngText: But <nickname>. Can completion\nalso be called growth?

KorText: 성장이란 어쩌면 그냥 다른\n모양을 경험하는 건 아닐지.
EngText: Perhaps growth is just\nexperiencing another form.

KorText: 마음에 들지 않는 나에서\n마음에 드는 나로.
EngText: From a self I don’t like into a self I like.

KorText: 미숙하고 치기 어린 나에서\n여유롭고 관능적인 나로.
EngText: From an inexperienced and immature\nme to a relaxed and sensual me.

KorText: 더 나아지고 있다는 믿음으로 모습을 바꾸는\n와중에, 이전의 순수함을 동경하게 된다면
EngText: If, during the change that I believe is\nprogress, I long for my past innocence
won’t it be too late to go back?
Hmm. <nickname>.
Do you ever want to\nprotect your innocence?
Hmm… in what way?

KorText: 너 자신의 본래적인 형태를 그리워한 적이 있냐는 뜻이야.
EngText: I mean have you ever\nmissed your original self.

KorText: 지금 다시 떠올려 보는 거야. 가장\n‘너'와 가까웠던 ‘너'의 모습을.
EngText: Picture it again. The ‘you’\nthat was closest to ‘you’.
Who I was when I was untainted…

KorText: 조금 더 친해진 것 같아,\n내 마음이 꾸물거리고 있네.
EngText: I think I know you better now,\nand my heart is squirming.
Oh! <nickname>.

KorText: 또는, 어쩌면, 내가 보는\n너의 모습을 말해 주자면
EngText: If, perhaps, I might speak on\nwho I see when I look at you,

KorText: 네 안에는 여전히 아이일 때의\n투명한 눈짓이 남아 있는 건 아닐까?
EngText: could it be you still have that pure\ngaze from when you were a child?

KorText: 달나라에서 온 나를 발견해 준 너니까.
EngText: After all, you found me.
…… Hehe.

KorText: 난 이제 아주 오랫동안 미동 없이 앉아서\n저 곰팡이의 포자들이 부유하는 걸 바라볼 거야.
EngText: Now I’m going to be still and watch\nthose spores drift midair, for a long time.

KorText: 그 어떤 것도 바라지\n않은 채, 바라만 볼 거야.
EngText: I won’t expect anything. I’ll simply observe.
You must be fond of being bored.|Any reason?

KorText: 응. 지루함은 찰기 없는 밀가루\n같은 감촉을 가지고 있거든.
EngText: Yes. Boredom is like dry dough, before\nyou add water and make it sticky.
Good to roll around in.
Interesting. And where is it\nthat you’re rolling around in?
A field of misery.
Oh? …. Why?

KorText: 쟤네, 살기 좋은 어딘가에 안착한다면\n곧 다글다글 번식해서 인간의 눈에 띌 거야.
EngText: If those spores settle somewhere nice, soon\nenough the whole family will be spotted.
And they’ll be removed.\nIn the blink of an eye.
Either burnt alive or melted down.

KorText: 살기 나쁜 어딘가에 안착한다면\n인간의 눈은 피할 수 있을 거야.
EngText: If they settle somewhere less savory,\nthey could avoid the humans’ eyes.
But they'll starve to death.
Slow and helpless.…
The life sucked out of them,\nleft to dry and crumble.

KorText: 난 그 무엇도 바라지 못해. 걸어\n두었던 희망이 꺾여서 돌아오면…
EngText: I won’t risk getting my hopes up. Because\nwhen that hope returns broken...
It’ll hurt. A lot.

KorText: (곰팡이가 번식해서 좋을 게 있나?)|(곰팡이가 괜히 안쓰러워 보여.)
EngText: (What good is mold?)|(I’m starting to feel sorry for them.)

KorText: 고작 곰팡이일 뿐이야. 보기에도\n흉하고 인간에게 무익해.
EngText: It’s only mold. Horrid to the\neye and harmful to humans.

KorText: 그건 나도 마찬가지 아니야?\n너에겐 나도 ‘고작’ 뭉치인 걸까.
EngText: But so am I. Do you see me\nthe way you see them?
……. <nickname>.

KorText: 아니, 아니야. 고작 뭉치가 아닌 무려 뭉치지!
EngText: No, never. You’re so much more than mold!
You’re my friend.|You’re lovable.
Plus, no effect on lung capacity whatsoever.

KorText: 그렇구나. 시간이 필요해. 잠시 혼자 있어야겠어.
EngText: I see. I need some time to think. Excuse me.

KorText: 저 빵 위로 떨어지는 애들도 있을걸.\n폭신한 침대에 뛰어드는 아이처럼!
EngText: I bet some of those spores will fall onto the\nbread. Like children jumping on the bed.

KorText: 그 아이들은 그들의 곰팡이 가족과\n폭신폭신 행복하게 살 수 있을 거야.
EngText: They could live their fluffy happy\ndays together with their family.
You really think so?
I see.
Thank you, <nickname>.

KorText: 난 이제 아주 오랫동안 미동 없이 앉아서\n얘네가 ‘빵 위로’ 떨어지길 바라 볼 거야.
EngText: Now I’m going to be still and hope\nfor them to fall onto the bread.
For a very long time.
